commitResults.messageTitle: Add gradle into project
commitResults.messageBody: Now able to run Duke and unit tests from Gradle.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add GUI using FXML to Duke, replace task date variable to LocalDateTime, add Pair class
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke now returns output to MainWindow. MainWindow controls where the output is displayed in the GUI. Pair class helps Duke transfer data to MainWindow easier.

LocalDateTime is used to make parsing of user input easier. Now date format can only take yyyy-mm-dd. Previously dash could've been replaced with any other token.

Date feature no longer requires a time. It returns all tasks occurring at the given date. This way the command is more intuitive.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add CheckStyle
commitResults.messageBody:
Format code to CheckStyle's requirements.

All switch statements now have default cases. Some methods now throw exception in the new default case. TaskList now has an additional constructor that takes in no arguments and initializes an empty ArrayList..................

commitResults.messageTitle: Duke now creates storage file if it does not exist from the start
commitResults.messageBody: Previously, Duke only created the storage file upon exit and saving the tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update shadowJar properties in build.gradle and ignore META-INF/Manifest.MF files
Use assertions to document important assumptions
commitResults.messageBody:
There are certain areas in the code that assume some invariants. For
example in Duke.java, the saveTasks() method assumes task can only be
of type ToDo, Deadline or Event.

Assertions help to confirm these invariants. They will indicate that
there is something fundamentally wrong with the code, should any of
them be triggered.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code quality by abstracting code
commitResults.messageBody:
Code was too messy and readability was bad. Abstracting code into
separate methods and classes made code easier to read and edit in the
future.

Storage exception handling for writing and reading is extracted from
Duke.java to Storage.java. StorageMissingException class created.

Input parsing for the various tasks is abstracted into common methods
and are now handled in their respective switch cases.

Each Task subclass now has a unique task label.

All formatters used for formatting date/time declared as constants.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add sort feature to Duke
commitResults.messageBody:
It is helpful to see tasks in chronological order so that users will
know which tasks are more urgent.

Sort allows user to list the tasks by date.
All tasks that are completed are listed at the start of the list.
Sort reverse allows user to reverse the list.

Deadline and Event no longer accommodate for incorrect format of date
time inputs. An exception is now thrown and the user is informed of the
incorrect format.

Storing incorrect date time inputs as strings makes the sorting very
confusing.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve GUI to make Duke look better
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke's GUI needed to look more pleasing and polished.

Changes:
1. Spacing between dialog boxes
2. Dialog boxes are color coded based on user(blue),
Duke(green) and error messages(red)
3. Duke and user icon images made into a circle
4. Made task list font better
5. Added borders to input box and send button
6. Dialog boxes now expand upwards on very long messages

Combined exception messages in UI into one method as the exception
methods were very similar.

Created DukeResponse class to replace Pair class as GUI now needed 3
pieces of information from Duke.

Fix a bug where Duke cannot retrieve task details with spacing. Tasks
stored in storage now have their details and timing on separate lines.

commitResults.messageTitle: Rename Duke to Dog-and-Cat (DaC)
commitResults.messageBody: Give my own personality to the chatbot.
